Certainly! Here are five foreign films you might enjoy on MUBI right now:

1. "Happy as Lazzaro" (Italy, 2018): A magical-realist story about a young man named Lazzaro who lives and works on a tobacco farm in rural Italy. When he befriends the farm's heiress, their lives take unexpected turns.

2. "Portrait of a Lady on Fire" (France, 2019): An acclaimed period romance about an artist who falls in love with the woman she's been hired to paint.

3. "The Wind Will Carry Us" (Iran, 1999): A surrealist drama about a group of strangers who arrive in a remote Iranian village to await the death of an old woman. As they wait, tensions rise and secrets are revealed.

4. "The Grand Bizarre" (USA/Lebanon, 2018): A visually stunning experimental documentary about the global trade in textiles and the people who make and sell them.

5. "Atlantics" (Senegal/France, 2019): A supernatural drama about a group of young workers who set out to sea in search of a better life, but tragedy strikes and their loved ones are left to deal with the aftermath.

I hope you enjoy watching these films!
